para.para.body: How to recognize a system of linear equations with exactly one solution.
In the RREF-display, possible rows of 0 â€™s have been omitted.
Suppose a system of linear equations yields an RREF-matrix without a leading 1 in its augmentation column, and such that the rank of the coefficient matrix equals the number of variables.
Then the system has exactly one solution.
The RREF-matrix corresponds to the system of linear equations

math.display.latex: \begin{array}{cccccccccc} \colorbox{lightgreen}{$1$} {\color{red} x_1} & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$0$} {\color{red}x_2} & + & \cdots & \cdots & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$0$} {\color{red} x_r} & = & {\color{blue} d_1 } \\ \colorbox{lightgreen}{$0$} {\color{red} x_1} & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$1$} {\color{red}x_2} & + & \cdots & \cdots & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$0$} {\color{red} x_r} & = & {\color{blue} d_2 } \\ % \vdots & & \vdots & & \ddots & & & \vdots & & {\color{blue} \vdots } \\ \vdots & & \vdots & & & \ddots & & \vdots & & {\color{blue} \vdots } \\ \colorbox{lightgreen}{$0$} {\color{red} x_1} & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$0$} {\color{red}x_2} & + & \cdots & \cdots & + & \colorbox{lightgreen}{$1$} {\color{red} x_r} & = & {\color{blue} d_r} \\ \end{array}
